In St. Louis, Missouri, it\u2019s illega: Undressed women (even if they are wearing a nightgown)

Where in the world can you find the most: Macau -- It is a gambling destination that's seven times greater than Las Vegas. It is also the most densely populated region in the world.

What is the oldest rainforest in the wor: Daintree rainforest -- Located in Australia, it is 180 million-years-old. By contrast, the Amazon rainforest is only 55 million-years-old.
Which ancient landmark was originally kn: The Acropolis of Athens -- The word “acropolis” translates to high city, but in ancient times the site was instead known by the name Cecropia — after the city’s mythical first king, Cecrops.
Which U.S. city\u2019s signature dish is: Cincinnati -- It can be a bit sweet in addition to spicy, featuring cinnamon, allspice, cloves, chili powder, cumin and oregano.

What is the oldest town in Texas?: Nacogdoches -- It is over 300 years old and was believed to have been founded by the Caddo Indians.
What is the biggest desert in Australia?: Great Victoria Desert -- Located in Western and South Australia, it is home to several nature reserves and a national park.
In which ocean can you find Australia\u2: Pacific -- It is comprised of over 3,000 reef systems and contains over 400 different types of coral and is visible from space.

What mode of transportation is Missouri: Canoe (An Illinois tribe's phrase for the area's people, "ouemessourita," translates to “wooden canoe people".)

The world\u2019s smallest bat is native: Thailand and Myanmar -- Kitti's Hog-Nosed Bat, more commonly known as the Bumblebee Bat, is 1.5 inches long and weighs 2 grams.
Which lake has the most fish species in: Lake Malawi - It is located in Africa between the countries Malawi, Mozambique and Tanzania.
What element is named for the island of: Copper (The word "copper" comes from the Greek name for the island of Cyprus, which was Kupros.)
How many U.S. states are named after a P: One (Washington is named after George Washington, the first U.S. president.)
Which settlers added an \"r\" to Arkansa: French (They were told by natives from an Illinois tribe that people in the area now called Arkansas were called "Akansa".)
What U.S. mountain range has a \"road to: Great Smoky Mountains -- A 7-mile stretch of road is what remains of a project that was canceled due to environmental concerns.
Where was Iceland's first permanent sett: Norway -- According to Iceland’s “The Book of Settlements” from the 12th century, the island’s first permanent settler arrived from Norway and was named Ingólfr Arnarson.
Which of the following African countries: Senegal -- Spanning eleven countries, the massive desert is about the size of the U.S. and is the largest hot desert in the world.

Which U.S. state holds the record for th: California -- The world’s two oldest known trees are Great Basin bristlecone pines, and they’re both found in California’s White Mountains. One is 5,062 years old and the other is 4,845.

Frederiksborg Castle is located in which: Denmark -- The castle occupies three islets in Castle Lake just north of Copenhagen. It was built between 1600 and 1620.
Which animal is paraded through Gstaad,: Cows -- Farmers dress their cows up with bells and flower crowns for the walk through town. The tradition started in 2014.
Where can you find the magnificent templ: Thailand -- The name Tiger Cave Temple comes from the tiger paw prints that are found in one of the caves in the area.
Which country has a fast food restaurant: Iran -- It is a loving tribute to McDonald's, serving halal burgers, crispy chicken nuggets, and French fries to customers.
Which beloved Parisian landmark was inte: Eiffel Tower -- Plans to demolish it in 1909 were abandoned when city officials recognized its value as a radiotelegraph station.
Lake Tahoe straddles the border of which: California and Nevada -- Located in the Sierra Mountains, its name is derived from the Washoe word "tahoe," which means "big water."

What was the first U.S. state to ban bil: Hawaii -- Billboards were banned in Hawaii in 1927.

What is the only U.S. state that borders: New York -- It borders Lake Ontario, Lake Erie and meets the Atlantic Ocean.

What country has the world's shortest co: Monaco -- It has a mere 2.5 miles of coastline along a world-famous section of the Mediterranean called the French Riviera.
What is the official currency of Russia?: Ruble -- The Russian ruble (abbreviated as RUB) has been used as the country’s currency since the 13th century — making it the second oldest currency still in use, after the British pound sterling.
From which mountain in the U.S. can you: Lookout Mountain, Georgia -- One can see seven states from the top on a clear day -- Tennessee, Alabama, South Carolina, North Carolina, Virginia, Kentucky and Georgia.
Which U.S. state is home to the world\u2: Texas -- Buc-ee’s in New Braunfels has 67,000 square feet of retail space — about 22 average-sized 7-Eleven stores — and 1,000 parking spaces.

Lake Victoria is the largest lake in Afr: Islands -- Spanning 26,600 square miles, Lake Victoria contains approximately 1,000 Islands, ranging from tiny dots of land to larger inhabited islands.

In England, the victim of an April Fool': A noodle -- Victims of April Fool's pranks in England may also be called a "gob", "gobby" or "noddy".
What sea separates China from the Korean: Yellow Sea -- Known as "Huang Hai" in Chinese and "Hwanghae" in Korean, the Yellow Sea gets its name because the sediment from rivers makes its color nearly yellow.
What is the national animal of Canada?: Beaver -- It played an important historical role in the early development of Canada, fueling the popular fur trade. During the peak, 100,000 pelts were shipped to Europe annually.

Where was the lowest temperature ever re: Prospect Creek Camp, Alaska -- It is located near the Arctic Circle along the Alaska pipeline. The temperature was -80 degrees Fahrenheit (-62 degrees Celsius) on January 23, 1971.
The prime meridian passes through which: London - The prime meridian, the imaginary line dividing the eastern and western hemispheres, passes through London’s Greenwich Observatory.
What is the newest country in Europe?: Kosovo -- In 2008, the country declared its independence from Serbia; in 2010, Kosovo’s sovereignty was formally recognized by the International Court of Justice.
What bird and its chicks are featured on: Pelican -- The flag also features three drops of the mother's blood, symbolizing Louisiana’s intention to sacrifice everything for its citizens.

Where in the world is the longest stretc: Saudia Arabia -- Highway 10 boasts the longest stretch (140 miles) of completely straight highway in the world.

The Golden Gate Bridge connects the city: Marin County -- Many tourist travel across the bridge into Marin County for a view of San Francisco.
Which country claims the island of Saipa: USA -- Saipan is part of the Northern Mariana Islands, which is a commonwealth of the U.S. Saipan is the seat of the government.
Where is the world's first underwater re: Maldives -- The Conrad Maldives Rangali Island hotel is home to Ithaa Undersea Restaurant, which opened in 2005.
The second highest mountain on land is K: Karakoram -- K2 is located in the Karakoram Mountain Range.
What two nations accompany England and S: Northern Ireland and Wales -- Great Britain is comprised of England, Scotland and Wales. Add Northern Ireland to Great Britain to create the U.K.
Which major city is located in both Euro: Istanbul -- It is one of only five transcontinental cities in the world. The city straddles the Bosphorus Strait, making its western side European and its eastern side Asian.

What is the oldest state park in the Uni: Although Yellowstone is America's oldest national park, New York’s Niagara Falls State Park was the first state park.
What is the name of the body of water th: John C. Frémont gave it the name "Chrysopylae" or "Golden Gate" on July 1, 1846. The strait is commonly called "Golden Gate".

In which mountain range can you find Aus: Australian Alps -- It is covered in ski resorts and in the summer, many people hike to its tallest peak, Mount Kosciuszko.

What was the original name of Denali?: Denali -- The name was changed to Mt. McKinley in 1896 after then-presidential candidate William McKinley.
What do Ireland and St. Lucia island hav: Both are named after historical women -- Saint Lucia got its name from Saint Lucy of Syracuse. Ireland is named after Erui, an ancient Irish mythological goddess.

Where is the original Jersey?: The original Jersey is an island in the English Channel that is a self-governing British crown dependency. It is the largest of Channel Islands, located just 12 miles off the coast of France.

South America\u2019s Atacama Desert hold: Driest non-polar desert -- Although it is home to about one million people, it records less than 1 mm of rain every year.

Where was the first capsule hotel?: Osaka, Japan -- Also known as pod hotels, capsule hotels are quirky, minimalist hotels that are not for the claustrophobic.

Where is the Sriracha hot sauce factory: Irwindale, California -- David Tran, a Vietnamese immigrant first started selling the red chili sauce out of his van in the 1970s.
What is Australia's top export?: Coal briquettes -- Australia is the world's largest exporter of coal briquettes. It exports most of its goods to China and Japan.

What African landmark has a local name t: Victoria Falls -- The Kololo tribe that was living in the area in the 1800s called it "Mosi-oa-Tunya," or The Smoke that Thunders.

What is the name of Wales\u2019 largest: Cardiff -- It is the capital of Wales and has a population of about 400,000.
What country is part of the U.K., but no: Northern Ireland -- Great Britain refers to the connected island of Britain, which is comprised of Scotland, England, and Wales.
What is the most common street name in t: Park, according to a Washington Post study

In Portugal, what object is traditionall: Flour (Flour bombing' is an established April Fool's Day practice in Portugal and some other countries.)

What is the oldest bridge across Venice': Rialto Bridge -- Built by architect-engineer Antonio da Ponte and his nephew, the bridge is supported by 6,000 timber piles.
Which American city is considered to be: Memphis, Tennessee -- In 1977, the U.S. Congress declared Beale Street to be the official "Home of the Blues".
Which city in the contiguous U.S. will l: Detroit -- From Detroit, drive south over the Ambassador Bridge across the Detroit River, and you’ll hit Windsor, Ontario.
What U.S. state is the smallest by land: Rhode Island -- At 1214 sq.mi., it is half the size of Miami-Dade County, FL (2431 sq. mi), but has nearly 400 miles of shoreline.
What country's Indigenous name translate: New Zealand -- In the 1200s, Maori settlers called the North Island "Aotearoa", which translates to "long white cloud".
Zion National Park is located in which U: Utah -- Zion National Park is a southwest Utah nature preserve distinguished by Zion Canyon’s steep red cliffs.

Which Caribbean island is the closest to: Bimini -- It is a tiny Bahamian island and is located just 50 miles east of Miami, Florida.

What city is home to the tallest skyscra: Dubai, UAE -- The Burj Khalifa soars over Dubai at a height of 2,717 ft. It has 163 floors with a hotel, residences and offices.
Which American city was home to the worl: Chicago -- The Home Insurance Building was 180 ft. tall. Constructed in 1885, it was demolished in 1931.
In which country can you find the world': Malaysia -- The Petronas Twin Towers in Kuala Lumpur are 1,483 feet tall and have a 400 ft. solid foundation, the world's largest.

Which European city has a hotel named af: Geneva, Switzerland -- Hotel President Wilson is named after him because it’s located near the United Nations Office at Geneva.
In what state can visit the former home: Ohio - He delivered his campaign speeches from the front porch of his home in Mentor, Ohio, which is now a National Historic Site.
What doughnut-like dessert is eaten on M: Paczki -- They are typically filled with jelly or custard but are heavier than doughnuts, as they are fried longer.
Pancake Day -- Christians fast during Lent. Pancakes were a great way to use up eggs and fat before the fast began.
Which U.S. city is known as the City of: Pittsburgh -- Thanks to three major rivers and their tributaries, Pittsburgh boasts 446 bridges and more than earns its nickname.
Which beach is trademarked Surf City USA: Huntington Beach, California -- Although Hawaii is the birthplace of modern surfing, Huntington Beach in Southern California is trademarked as Surf City USA.
Where was America\u2019s first boardwalk: Atlantic City Boardwalk, New Jersey -- Built in 1870, the original purpose of the boardwalk was to keep sand out of the lobbies of the ritzy beachfront hotels.
Which continental U.S. state has the mos: Florida -- Alaska has the most coastline, but Florida has the most beaches. It has 1,350 miles of coastline, which includes 850 miles of beaches.

Which countries does France share a land: Spain, Luxembourg, Belgium, Switzerland, Monaco, Andorra, Germany and Italy

In Ireland, what is known as \"the Black: Guinness -- Even though Ireland’s famous potent potable is often referred to as "the Black Stuff", Guinness is actually a deep ruby red color.
What does the Japanese term \"Sandai Wag: Three Big Beefs (Sandai Wagyu are "the three big beefs" - Matsusaka, Ōmi and the most-famous of all, Kobe.)
For the film \"The Empire Strikes Back,\: The Battle of Hoth scenes were shot on Handangerjokulen Glacier near the village of Finse, Norway.
What is the state flower of Arizona?: Saguaro cactus blossom -- Pronounced sa-WAH-ro, it grows only in a specific area of the Sonoran Desert, and is found in no other U.S. state outside of Arizona.
What non-flower is the state flower of M: Pine cone -- Maine even sent pine cones as its representation in the National Garland of Flowers arrangement the U.S. prepared for the 1893 World’s Fair.
What common plant of the American West i: Sagebrush -- It is common in the southwest, but it is not a true desert shrub. It has been used by Native Americans to make teas with healing properties.
The official bud of five states, what is: Rose -- North Dakota, Georgia, Iowa, New York and Oklahoma. Washington, D.C. claims American Beauty Rose as its official flower. The rose is also America's national flower.

Which country was the first to have its: Sweden -- The official phone number (+46 771 793 336), is part of a marketing campaign from the Swedish Tourist Association.

Which city is home to the world's larges: San Francisco -- The Hyatt Regency's lobby spans 42,000 sq. ft. (a Guinness record) and features a 20-story atrium.

What do Vatican City and San Marino have: Both are landlocked in another country -- Vatican City and San Marino are two of the smallest countries in the world, and they’re both landlocked by Italy.
What state is home to the only Bah\u00e1: Illinois -- Bahá’í is a religion that aims to unify all religions and races together as one and promote world peace.

The film \"Twilight\" was shot at which: Cannon Beach in Oregon -- It’s not a typical sunny and tropical beach, but the beach is still so cinematically beautiful that film scenes are filmed there.

Venice's Contarini Fasan Palace is tradi: The Palace is traditionally believed to be the home of Desdemona, Othello's doomed wife in the Shakespeare play "Othello".
What is Bhutan's national sport?: Archery -- It was born out of necessity as bows and arrows were used to repel Tibetans and British invaders in the 19th century.
In which Alaskan town do almost all resi: In the small town of Whittier, Alaska, almost all residents live in the same building — a property called Begich Towers
Which is the only U.S. state whose motto: Minnesota's motto is  "L'etoile du Nord," which in English is "Star of the North."
Which U.S. state has the unofficial mott: Vermont (The unofficial motto “Stella Quarta Decima Fulgeat” was adopted in 2015 after being proposed by a Vermonter Latin student.)
What city is home to the world's oldest: Venice -- The Theatre Saint Moses opened in 1638 and featured an area where patrons could gamble during intermission.
Venice's famed Bridge of Sighs connects: Prisons -- The bridge connects an old prison inside the Doge's Palace to a newer one across the Rio di Palazzo.
What animal is considered to be symbolic: Lion -- The Lion of St. Mark is a symbol that appears throughout the city. It honors St. Mark, who is the patron saint of Venice.
Washington D.C. is located in which stat: None, it is not part of any US state
Coney Island is located on what island?: It is not on an island. It is in Brooklyn
Where can you find a soccer stadium that: Macapá, Brazil -- The city's Estádio Milton Corrêa soccer stadium's center line lies exactly on the equator.
Which landlocked body of water is locate: The surface of the Dead Sea is a salt lake located about 1275 ft (0.39 km) below sea level.
Which two small states are surrounded by: San Marino and the Vatican City
Where is America\u2019s oldest continual: Orefield, Pennsylvania -- Opened in 1934, Shankweiler’s Drive-In Theatre is an American institution.
Where can you find \"Muscle Beach\" in t: Venice Beach, California -- Muscle Beach attracts bodybuilders from all over with its unique outdoor weight room on the beach.
In which U.S. city will you find Vieux C: New Orleans, Louisiana -- Known to most tourists as the French Quarter, the term means "Old Square."
Mt. Elbrus, the tallest peak in Europe,: Russia -- The native Balkars call it "Mingi-Tau", which means "resembling a thousand mountains," due to its sheer size.
Which Canadian provinces are known as th: New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island
Lake Constance is shared by which three: Austria, Switzerland and Germany -- The international borders inside the lake have never been settled.
What are the five boroughs of New York C: Brooklyn, Queens, The Bronx, Manhattan and Staten Island
Where is the Neolithic stone circle call: Scotland -- Located on the largest island of the Orkney archipelago off the coast of Scotland, it was likely erected during the Bronze Age around 2,500 B.C.
Where on the European continent is locat: Gibraltar -- Originally from the Atlas Mountains and the Rif Mountains of Morocco, the Barbary macaque population in Gibraltar has existed for centuries.
Which two islands makes up a commonwealt: Barbuda and Redonda -- The three-island nation is in the Lesser Antilles. Redondo is uninhabited and was formed from a volcano.
Who was the state Louisiana named after?: King Louis XIV of France -- Explorer René-Robert Cavelier named the area to honor his king. "La Louisiane" translates to "Land of Louis".
